page.title: 17Staploe, Transport
page.content: One public bus runs from Duloe and Staploe to St. Neots on Thursdays and until 1984 a privately commissioned one from Honeydon. The parish council have petitioned the bus company. With everyone except farm workers moving out to work, own transport is the overriding necessity of residents. The road system developed from old farm tracks, hollow ways and anclosure roads. Sheaker's Way is too narrow for cars to pass normally, Honeydon's roads are sunken, with blind corners and steep banks. With the continued growth of Eaton Socon, these roads are carrying increasingly inappropriate traffic, avoiding congestion on the old A1. The hamlets do not qualify for a speed limit. Accidents have increased, cycling and walking dangerous and rubbish is dumped and the environment and habitat damaged.
